speaker: Viral image
vclaim: A welcoming sign of Wisconsin with a warning letter "criminals and terrorists" says that more than 170,000 people in Wisconsin have a legal permit to carry a gun.
date: stated on April 16, 2013 in a Facebook post:
title: Viral Wisconsin welcomes the signing of a warning photo visitors from the population carrying his weapon filming
text: A long-solved viral article shows what appears to be a welcome sign to the state of Wisconsin. The photo, originally published in April 2013, contains 54,000 shares and shows a sign "Welcome to Wisconsin" with a warning message: More than 170,000 Wisconsin residents have legal permission to carry a gun. They are armed and ready to defend themselves and others against criminal violence. You've been warned. Illinois and Chicago have been disarmed for your convenience. The picture was highlighted as part of Facebook efforts to combat false news and misleading information in its broadcast. ∙ (Read more about our partnership with Facebook.) No, Wisconsin does not have a welcome sign that warns visitors of its own inhabitants who possess weapons. The complete message under "Welcome to Wisconsin" is Photoshop and attached to the sign to make it look authentic. The results of the search for the image in reverse reveal the original image - which does not include the letter - that was uploaded on the Wikimedia Comnes site in November 2008. According to the image description, the sign is located on Route 10 in the United States on the eastern side of the state. On January 11, 2021, Facebook published an article in Facebook by Nancy Belusi that was no longer the Speaker of the House of Representatives by Samantha Buterman: January 12, 2021 Christine McHugh, Director of Public Affairs of the Ministry of Transport of Wisconsin, also told Politi Fucket that the picture had been rounded. "DOT Wisconsin has not made or authorized such a signal anywhere in the state," McHugh wrote in the e-mail. "This is a planned image using a language similar to that of welcoming signs, which is also considered false, in other states. If any of these illegal signs are actually installed, they will be removed under state law 86.19." This law specifies the places where markings can be established and the circumstances in which they must be removed by the authorities. The law also establishes fines and other penalties to ignore the law and distort existing highway signs. According to McHugh, Wisconsin is not the only country that has digitally changed its welcoming sign to include a false weapon warning. Various messages were photographed on multiple welcoming signals from states including Idaho, Michigan and Louisiana. Our judgment warns an old viral picture of a welcome sign on the Wisconsin Road of "criminals and terrorists" that more than 170,000 state residents have permits to carry guns. The real sign simply says "Welcome to Wisconsin" - the rest of the photos are Photoshop. We're assessing these pants on fire! Sharing the facts of 2019-05-30 15:42:03 UTC Politics Fact 1 1 7 PolityFacting: Pants on Fire says a welcome sign in Wisconsin that includes a warning message "criminals and terrorists" that more than 170,000 Wisconsin residents have legal permission to carry a gun.
